title: SB 1.18.14 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 04-04-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and invocations.

segments.key_quote: Krishna's topics are so relishable that you go on hearing and you never become saturated.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam 1.18.14, emphasizing the inexhaustible nature of Krishna's topics and the unending satisfaction derived from hearing about Him.

segments.key_quote: There is something about it which is different from all material songs material song vibrations so the topics about Krishna are like that you will never get saturated you never
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts material experiences, which lead to saturation, with the unending satisfaction derived from chanting the Hare Krishna mantra and hearing about Krishna.

segments.key_quote: Krishna's qualities are unlimited wonderful qualities all of them are wonderful qualities Krishna is no tinge of any bad quality only good qualities and those qualities are innumerable
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the unlimited and wonderful qualities of Krishna, emphasizing that even great mystics like Shiva and Brahma cannot fully comprehend them.

segments.key_quote: Lord Shiva drank an ocean of poison of which one drop was sufficient to kill an ordinary living being
segments.summary: The speaker narrates the story of Lord Shiva drinking the ocean of poison to illustrate his immense mystic power, as an example of the powers that even great demigods possess.

segments.key_quote: Brahma and Shiva are not the supreme powerful the supreme powerful is Govinda or Lord Krishna he is the transcendence and his transcendental attributes cannot be measured even by such powerful Ishwaras as Shiva and Brahma
segments.summary: The speaker discusses Brahma's mystic power of creation and clarifies that while Brahma and Shiva are powerful, Krishna is the supreme powerful being, whose attributes are immeasurable.

segments.key_quote: Krishna is the reservoir of all pleasures enjoyment in this world nobody can give as much enjoyment as discussing or hearing or remembering or talking about the pastimes of Krishna which give so much transcendental happiness
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that Krishna is the source of unlimited pleasure and that engaging in devotional service, such as hearing about Krishna, provides unending satisfaction.

segments.key_quote: The mystics derive unlimited transcendental pleasures from the absolute truth and therefore the supreme absolute truth the personality of God it is also known as Rama
segments.summary: The speaker quotes a verse from the Padma Purana, explaining that yogis derive unlimited pleasure from the Absolute Truth, also known as Rama.

segments.key_quote: Suta Goswami is eager to speak and the sages are eager to hear so this is the perfect ideal combination
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by highlighting the eagerness of both Suta Goswami to speak and the sages of Naimisaranya to hear about Krishna, creating a perfect environment for spiritual discourse.
